column4: hey guys. I have an ati radeon x1250 that I am trying to install drivers for, anybody on here that could give me a walkthrough?
on Ubuntu 9.04?
yes
Ok, i dunno how far the legacy drivers has come(long story short: lateast drivers for older than radeon 2xxx does not support new improved xorg).
so what are my options
If you want 3D performance than your not in good luck, unless legacy has come along. If you just want video and 2D to work, then the free drivers wokr(and i dunno how to install)
ati radeon x1250 is listed in the legacy drivers
ok
give me a few seconds
to write down all you need to know :P
ok, then it is to downgrade the x server i guess
what is the xserver
something on display and grapics and 3D
the system needs it
ok so i need to have an older xserver in order to run the ati legacy driver correctly?
yupp, or you could use the opensource driver. I dunno if it is installed upon install Ubuntu how it is
and also what about envyng?
I am sad to say so, but i got no clue <.<
If there was a working legacy driver this would have been over already after some nifty copy-paste <.<
well I am not convinced that there is nothing I can do, thanks for your help though
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RadeonDriver My nift random searching might help <.<
